Articles.Content:
Are there any K.S.P. Modpacks?

That is a compilation of mods that are all able to run at the same time and/or interact with eachother.

I'm just curious because I'm an ex-Minecraft player and that game was filled with them.

If there are any, be sure to post the names of them and/or links to them.

Realism Overhaul is about the closest thing to a modpack that I know of, but it's really just a list of mods to download and install, and some scripts to tie them all together. Mod packs aren't really needed.for KSP because it is laughably easy to install mods. Also:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/66270-ks-are-they-legal-and-ethical

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/62956-KSP-needs-a-lazy-newb-pack

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61829-MOD-Packs

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50048-Assembling-a-Mod-Pack

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68332-Is-there-such-a-thing-as-a-modpack-for-KSP

There are not really mod-packs here mainly because licensing is strictly required and enforced for mods. Mod packs would probably tend to combine mods with incompatible licenses. And a couple of the more popular mods (Kethane is a good example) have licenses that prohibit distribution altogether.
